Europe team has rapidly expanded, to now cover all 38 countries in Europe and the 5 Europe business units, and the focus on D&A informing business decisions in Europe is greater than ever.

We are now creating a new Data and Analytics team in East Europe, to provide leadership in data and analytics across all East Europe regions, and all 5 Business Units.

We are looking for an experienced D&A Data Analyst to join the East Europe D&A team. This role can be based anywhere in East Europe and will report into East Europe D&A Lead as part of our wider European D&A organization.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with experience in Microsoft data modeling and visualization who can implement high-performant data analytics solutions that use our data to solve complex business issues and create value for Unilever.

Our Data & Analytics team is uniquely partnered within the business organization to ensure that we are delivering the best possible insights to help our business grow. • Ensure that deliverables meet or exceed functional, technical, and performance requirements
• Contribute to the development of your own and the business’s technical acumen and skills
• Continuous learning of new tools & programming languages via external sources that bring direct value to the business
• Future Fit- Building and actively using a network of peers across Unilever Europe and Globally to both export & import best practices

• B.S. or M.S in a relevant field (Business Analytics, Operations Research), or PhD, M.S. in a relevant technical field (Operations Research, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or Mathematics)
• Overall experience of 5+ years preferred
• Strong analytical skills with experience in problem-solving and being able to implement and deliver solutions
• Ability to rapidly connect + match analytics and data products to business needs
• Expert knowledge in the whole analytics process (business requirements, data ingestion, data modelling, and data visualization)
• Proficient in an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI (essential), and Advanced Excel
• Proficiency in M (Power Query) and DAX (essential) and Python (preferable)
• Proficiency in connecting to Microsoft Azure and publishing to PowerBI service to develop scaled analytic models in the cloud
• Ability to manage multiple requests and priorities simultaneously in a highly VUCA and competitive market
• Passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
• Ability to apply an agile analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision
• Ability to communicate complex quantitative insights in a precise, and actionable manner

Key Leadership Qualities
• Growth mindset and a bias for action
• Ability to challenge established norms in a constructive way and drive change
• Ability to manage a large and complex set of stakeholders & hold others accountable
• Ability to make the complex and technical simple to a non-technical audience
• Working effectively in cross-functional, cross-geography teams

Technical Skills
• Data Transformation and Cleaning Fully Operational
• Analytical Modelling and Patterns Fully Operational

• Python Working Knowledge

If your passion is science and you want to be part of a team that makes a bigger impact on patients’ lives, then there’s no better place to be. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline
